track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Join Week of Code 24, a 7 day contest beginning Monday, October 10 at 12:00am PST, 12:30pm IST, 7:00am UTC

Each day, we’ll unlock a new challenge for you to solve. The top 10 hackers win exclusive HackerRank T-shirts. We’ll send you a quick reminder each day to keep you on track. Sign up now and we'll see you on the leaderboard!

model.name: Happy Ladybugs
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int
        b <- getLine


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Determine whether or not all the ladybugs can be made happy.
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
            { ok, [B]} = io:fread("", "~s")
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
Q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < Q do
    n = io.read("*number", "*l")
    b = io.read()
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
